1.plot: Kaye has success growing Jerusalem Artichokes or sun chokes for the first time, seedling to harvest.

3.title: Kaye Recommends UK Here We Grow
3.plot: Kaye connects with an inestimable gardener in South Wales, UK.

4.title: Rain Barrel Install DIY & Challenges
4.plot: Kaye takes on a huge project to capture more rain water.

5.title: Winter Garden-Raised Bed, Cover Crop, Worm Tower, More!
5.plot: Kaye creates a worm tower, cover crops, and updates the raised beds.

6.plot: Kaye takes a 7 day challenge to eat the greens she's grown.

4.title: Rainy Day
4.plot: Find out what you can plant in the garden on a cold, rainy day.

5.title: Downpour!
5.plot: Kaye learns a lesson in being prepared for a storm, while attempting to catch the rainwater.

6.title: One Gun Ranch
6.plot: Kaye visits One Gun Ranch in Malibu, CA, to see their biodynamic garden and compost operation.

7.title: Planting Lettuce
7.plot: Kaye visits biodynamic farmer John McAndrew for his fool-proof planting lettuce method.

8.title: Growing Purple Cabbage
8.plot: Kaye recounts her tale of triumph over garden pests in her first cabbage-growing experience.

9.title: Growing Carrots
9.plot: Kaye plants and harvests her first carrots.

10.title: Memorial Day in the Garden
10.plot: Kaye gets a lot done in the garden on Memorial Day weekend, with neighbors' help.

11.title: Growing Sunflowers
11.plot: Kaye tries growing sunflowers from seed for the first time and learns some important lessons.

12.title: My Flower Island
12.plot: Kaye plants and replants flower seeds in her flower island. She finds success with buckwheat.

13.title: July 4th in the Garden
13.plot: Join in the urban garden fun and fireworks in Kaye's July 4th episode.

14.title: Gardens of Woodside
14.plot: Kaye visits the Woodside Library California Native Plant Garden and Woodside Elementary School garden.

16.title: Monarchs and Milkweed
16.plot:

17.title: Zucchini Madness
17.plot: Check out Kaye's first try at growing zucchini in her front yard edible garden.

18.title: Growing Tomatoes in the Front Yard
18.plot: Kaye plants tomatoes for the first time and does battle with blossom end rot.

19.title: Growing Watermelon
19.plot: Kaye gives growing watermelon a try in the front yard to mixed results.

20.title: Growing Corn in the Parkway
20.plot: Kaye plants one of favorites, corn! How hard can it be?

1.title: Winter Garden Part 1: Planting the Winter Garden
1.plot: Kaye gets her winter garden planted from seed. Starring a Fig Beetle and grub.

2.title: Winter Garden Part 2: Maintaining the Winter Garden
2.plot: Kaye gets in a little thinning during the cold days of winter.

3.title: Winter Garden Part 3: Winter Garden Update
3.plot: Kaye harvests radishes and carrots and plants berry vines.

4.title: Harvesting First Winter Vegetables on St. Patrick's Day
4.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

5.title: Tomatomania
5.plot: Kaye visits the world's largest heirloom tomato plant sale, Tomatomania, at Descanso Gardens.

6.title: Harvesting Winter Garden Vegetables
6.plot: Kaye harvests chard and battles aphids, includes the animation "Awful Aphids."

7.title: Summer Urban Garden Plantings on Mother's Day
7.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

8.title: Preserving the Old Corn Growing Tradition
8.plot: Kaye visits a heritage corn farmer and stone mill grinder in Tennessee.

9.title: Arts & Ag: Part 1
9.plot: Kaye takes a tour of local artisans and sustainable farms in rural Tennessee.

10.title: Arts & Ag: Part 2
10.plot: Kaye takes a tour of local sustainable farms and artisans in rural Tennessee.

11.title: Arts & Ag: Part 3
11.plot: Kaye takes a tour of sustainable farms and local artisans in rural Tennessee.

12.title: Easter Winter Garden Wrap-up
12.plot: Everything's got to come out, but first a little tango with sweet peas and pests.

13.title: Transition from Winter to Summer Garden
13.plot: Kaye landscapes, fences and plants her summer garden, with a how-to on planting corn.

14.title: Summer Garden Update Part 1
14.plot: Kaye brings us up to date with what got out of control in her summer California garden, encounters with wild parrots and mildew on cucumbers, corn takes off! Potatoes harvested, flytraps installed, California natives planted.

15.title: Summer Garden Update Part 2
15.plot: Kaye's front yard edible garden is standing room only with corn, beans, tomatoes, amaranth, sunflowers, zucchini and more. Wild parrots finish off the sunflowers. The mildew that got the cucumbers moves in for the kill on the melons.

16.title: National Heirloom Expo 2013
16.plot: Kaye visits the National Heirloom Expo in Santa Rosa, CA 2013, and offers a taste of the expo.

17.title: Summer Garden Update Part 3
17.plot: Kaye harvests late season tomatoes and zucchini and deals with blight, mildew and aphids on milkweed. Get a glimpse of garden spiders and beautiful flowers.

18.title: Los Angeles County Fair Fairview Farms
18.plot: Kaye drops into the one-acre organic produce farm at the L.A. County Fair which provides produce for the on-site restaurant and teaches kids about the food system and where food comes from. Get a taste of the fair and have fun with Kaye.

19.title: Summer Garden Wrap-up
19.plot: Kaye's got a big mildew problem on her squash, cucumbers and melons and the summer garden ends with mixed results, but Kaye visits a friend's squash patch for advice and gets started planting her winter garden.

20.title: Rainy Day with Sparrows and Monarchs
20.plot: Season 2 finale is a tour of the Late Bloomer garden on a rare rainy day in Los Angeles. Kaye finds Monarch caterpillars and sparrows searching for food.

1.title: Growing Sweet Peas Part 1
1.plot: Kaye plants sweet peas and plants are ready to harvest in January. Half the front yard garden is taken up in sweet peas which Kaye enjoys fresh from the vine, but mildew threatens.

2.title: Growing Sweet Peas Part 2
2.plot: The conclusion of Kaye's sweet pea growing. Pea vines took a turn in January and got hit with mildew.

3.title: Living Sustainably in Tennessee
3.plot: Kaye visits East Tennessee and learns how a couple have turned their retirement into a mandate for living sustainably from growing their own food and to preserving a centuries old farm for future generations.

4.title: Winter Garden Update
4.plot: Kaye plants and harvests the winter garden with help from a child, teaching her where food comes from.

5.title: Growing Savoy Cabbage Part 1
5.plot: Kaye grows Savoy Cabbage for the first time and deals with a heat wave.

6.title: Growing Savoy Cabbage Part 2
6.plot: Kaye harvests a Savoy Cabbage from her front yard garden and shares a recipe.

7.title: Growing Parkway Kale
7.plot: Kaye grows four varieties of kale in her parkway and shares the bounty with neighbors.

8.title: Plant a Parkway Food Forest
8.plot: Kaye plants perennials in her parkway garden for a year-round food forest.

9.title: Growing Garlic in an Urban Garden
9.plot: Kaye knocks it out of the park growing garlic for the first time.

10.title: Grow a Native Meadow in Your Yard
10.plot: Half of Kaye's parkway was planted in California native plants to create a mini meadow in 2013. Kaye checks out the progress.

11.title: Summer Garden Update
11.plot: Three years of soil-building gets Kaye's third summer garden off to a great start in this July update. Get a peak at the parkway and Kaye eats her first ripe tomato.

12.title: Growing Heirloom Tomatoes Part 1
12.plot: Kaye seeds several varieties of heirloom tomatoes.

13.title: Growing Heirloom Tomatoes Part 2
13.plot: Kaye's heirloom tomatoes get hit with lots of pests.

14.title: Growing Heirloom Tomatoes Part 3
14.plot: Tomato vines get out of control and Kaye has to do some carpentry.

15.title: Growing Heirloom Tomatoes Part 4
15.plot: The tomato harvest is huge in August and Kaye deals with more pests and tomato diseases.

16.title: Growing Heirloom Tomatoes Part 5
16.plot: Kaye's heirloom tomato epic reveals her top 6 picks and the community you can build in a front yard garden.

17.title: Growing Mexican Sunflower
17.plot: Kaye shows why Mexican Sunflower should be a staple in any garden.

18.title: Growing Peppers - Part 1
18.plot: Kaye recounts her pepper story: planting pepper seed for the first time, dealing with pests and harvesting baskets of hot and sweet peppers.

19.title: Growing Peppers - Part 2
19.plot: Kaye concludes her pepper growing story covering pests, preserving and seed saving. She also eats a cayenne.

20.title: The Joys & Challenges of Growing Carrots
20.plot: Kaye recounts three years of growing carrots in her front yard.

1.title: February Blooms!
1.plot: Kaye introduces the episode with a gorgeous slide show of flower images with original music, and a postcard from guest Stephen from Alberta Urban Garden.

2.title: Grow Borage to Attract Bees
2.plot: Kaye shares growing borage in the garden to repel pests and attract bees.

3.title: Growing Heirloom Beans - Part 1
3.plot: Kaye chronicles growing a number of variety of heirloom beans and pests that attacked them.

4.title: Earth Day Flowers
4.plot: Kaye celebrates Earth Day with a flower slide show and viewer mail.

5.title: Growing Heirloom Beans - Part 2
5.plot: Kaye concludes her bean story with Creams cowpeas and pests that attacked them.

6.title: Extreme Garden Makeover - Day 1
6.plot: Kaye transforms her front yard garden from winter to summer and guests prepare a scrumptious meal with the harvest.

7.title: Extreme Garden Makeover - Day 2
7.plot: Kaye concludes the transformation from winter to summer garden.

8.title: Harvesting Carrots
8.plot: Kaye details harvesting a raised bed full of carrots, and covers various issues of growing carrots.

9.title: Summer Solstice Garden Update
9.plot: Kaye takes advantage of the longest day of the year to share her lush garden.

10.title: Conserve Water in Your Garden
10.plot: Kaye covers water saving strategies for your garden.

11.title: An Ode to Rain
11.plot: Kaye features the record-breaking July 18th rain in Los Angeles and rainwater capture.

12.title: Growing Corn in a Raised Bed
12.plot: Kaye shares growing tips and her harvest of sweet corn grown in a raised bed.

13.title: August Harvest & Issues Part 1
13.plot: Learning to garden from scratch in 2012, Kaye chronicles her journey to become an organic urban garden food grower.

14.title: August Harvest & Issues Part 2
14.plot: Mildew threatens to overwhelm August vegetables.

15.title: Growing Peppers in Pots
15.plot: Kaye covers growing peppers in pots from seed to seed.

16.title: Grow Broomcorn for Brooms & Fall Decor
16.plot: Kaye shows broomcorn growing in her parkway and visits a handmade broom shop in Vancouver, BC.

17.title: Mob Grazing with Lee McCormick - Farm to Table in Pinewood
17.plot: Kaye visits Pinewood Farm and interviews sustainable cattle rancher Lee McCormick.

18.title: Winter Squash Part 1
18.plot: Kaye covers growing spaghetti squash and Cinderella pumpkin in her front yard garden.

19.title: Winter Squash Part 2
19.plot: Kave covers growing rare cushaw squash and kabocha squash in her front yard garden.

20.title: Magnificent Monarchs - Migrations & Metamorphosis
20.plot: Kaye travels along the California Coast in search of overwintering Monarch butterflies and covers their metamorphosis in striking photography.

imdb.title: Late Bloomer
plot: Kaye chronicles her first edible garden in episodes of the web series _Late Bloomer_ (qv).::Kaye Kittrell
